entry.name: MAV_TYPE_ASV_SDR_PAYLOAD
entry.description: Used to identify Software-defined radio payload in HEARTBEAT packet.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_SET_MODE
entry.description: Start one of ASV_SDR_CUSTOM_MODE. Can be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.
entry.param: Frequency in Hz, 0-3 bytes of uint_64, ignored for IDLE mode (uint32).
Frequency in Hz, 4-7 bytes of uint_64, ignored for IDLE mode (uint32).
Record rate in Hz, ignored for IDLE mode (float).
Sending data thinning ratio. Each specified amount of recorded data will be skipped before it is sent over the communication channel. (uint32).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_START_RECORD
entry.description: Start recoring data with unique name (max 28 chars). Can be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_STOP_RECORD
entry.description: Stop recoring data. Can be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_SET_RECORD_TAG
entry.description: Set custom tag to current record. Can be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.
entry.param: Tag value data 0-3 bytes depends on the type of tag.
Tag value data 4-7 bytes depends on the type of tag.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_SYSTEM_CONTROL_ACTION
entry.description: Send shutdown or reboot command. Can be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_WAIT_VEHICLE_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Waiting for a vehicle mission waypoint point. Can be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_DELAY
entry.description: Waiting a certain amount of time. Can be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_START_MISSION
entry.description: Starting mission, uploaded to SDR payload. Can't be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.
entry.param: Index of the task to start the mission (uint32).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ASV_SDR_STOP_MISSION
entry.description: Start mission, uploaded to SDR. Can't be used in the mission protocol for SDR payloads.

entry.name: ASV_SDR_MISSION_STATE_IDLE
entry.description: Do nothing

entry.name: ASV_SDR_MISSION_STATE_PROGRESS
entry.description: Mission in progress

entry.name: ASV_SDR_MISSION_STATE_ERROR
entry.description: Mission failed

enum.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_TYPE
enum.description: Specifies the datatype of a record tag (unit8_t).

entry.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_TYPE_UINT64
entry.description: 64-bit unsigned integer

entry.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_TYPE_INT64
entry.description: 64-bit signed integer

entry.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_TYPE_REAL64
entry.description: 64-bit floating-point

entry.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_TYPE_STRING8
entry.description: String type terminated by NULL if the length is less than 8 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 8 chars.

enum.name: ASV_SDR_CUSTOM_MODE
enum.description: A mapping of SDR payload modes for custom_mode field of heartbeat. Value of enum must be equal to message id from ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_* 13150-13199

entry.name: ASV_SDR_CUSTOM_MODE_IDLE
entry.description: Default mode. Do nothing.

entry.name: ASV_SDR_CUSTOM_MODE_LLZ
entry.description: Localizer measure mode. In this mode should send and record ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_LLZ

entry.name: ASV_SDR_CUSTOM_MODE_GP
entry.description: Glide Path measure mode. In this mode should send and record ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_GP

entry.name: ASV_SDR_CUSTOM_MODE_VOR
entry.description: VOR measure mode. In this mode should send and record ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_VOR

enum.name: ASV_SDR_REQUEST_ACK
enum.description: ACK / NACK / ERROR values as a result of ASV_SDR_*_REQUEST or ASV_SDR_*_DELETE commands.

entry.name: ASV_SDR_REQUEST_ACK_OK
entry.description: Request is ok.

entry.name: ASV_SDR_REQUEST_ACK_IN_PROGRESS
entry.description: Command already in progress.

entry.name: ASV_SDR_REQUEST_ACK_FAIL
entry.description: Command error.

entry.name: ASV_SDR_SYSTEM_CONTROL_ACTION_REBOOT
entry.description: Request system reboot [!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]

entry.name: ASV_SDR_SYSTEM_CONTROL_ACTION_SHUTDOWN
entry.description: Request system shutdown [!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]

entry.name: ASV_SDR_SIGNAL_FORMAT_RANGE_FLOAT_8BIT
entry.description: Write a value as a fraction between a given minimum and maximum. Uses 8 bits so we have '256' steps between min and max.

entry.name: ASV_SDR_SIGNAL_FORMAT_RANGE_FLOAT_16BIT
entry.description: Write a value as a fraction between a given minimum and maximum. Uses 16 bits so we have '65535' steps between min and max.

entry.name: ASV_SDR_SIGNAL_FORMAT_FLOAT
entry.description: Write a value as a float. Uses 32 bits.

message.name: ASV_SDR_OUT_STATUS
message.description: SDR payload status message. Send with 1 Hz frequency [!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!].
message.field: Record GUID. Also by this field we can understand if the data is currently being recorded (GUID!=0x00) or not (GUID==0x00).

Record name, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 28 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 28 chars - applications have to provide 28+1 bytes storage if the name is stored as string. If the data is currently not being recorded, than return null;

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_REQUEST
message.description: Request list of ASV_SDR_RECORD from the system/component.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies a unique number for this request. This allows the response packet to be identified.
Specifies the start index of the records to be sent in the response.
Specifies the number of records to be sent in the response after the skip index.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_RESPONSE
message.description: Response for ASV_SDR_RECORD_REQUEST request. If success, device additional send ASV_SDR_RECORD items from start to stop index.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies the unique number of the original request. This allows the response to be matched to the correct request.
Number of items ASV_SDR_RECORD for transmition after this request with success result code (depended from request).

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD
message.field: Record GUID. Generated by payload after the start of recording.

Record name, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 28 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 28 chars - applications have to provide 28+1 bytes storage if the name is stored as string.
Record data type(it is also possible to know the type of data inside the record by cast enum to int).
Total data size of record with all data items and tags.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_DELETE_REQUEST
message.description: Request to delete ASV_SDR_RECORD items from the system/component.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies a unique number for this request. This allows the response packet to be identified.
Specifies GUID of the record to be deleted.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_DELETE_RESPONSE
message.field: Specifies the unique number of the original request. This allows the response to be matched to the correct request.
Specifies the GUID of the record that was deleted.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_REQUEST
message.description: Request list of ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG from the system/component.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Request unique number. This is to allow the response packet to be detected.
Specifies the GUID of the record.
Specifies the start index of the tag to be sent in the response.
Specifies the number of tag to be sent in the response after the skip index.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_RESPONSE
message.description: Response for ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_REQUEST. If success, device additional send ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG items from start to stop index.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies the unique number of the original request. This allows the response to be matched to the correct request.
Number of items ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG for transmition after this request with success result code (depended from request).

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG
message.description: Request to read info with either tag_index and record_index from the system/component.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Tag name, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Tag value, depends on the type of tag.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_DELETE_REQUEST
message.description: Request to delete ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG from the system/component.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies the unique number of the original request. This allows the response to be matched to the correct request.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_TAG_DELETE_RESPONSE
message.field: Specifies the unique number of the original request. This allows the response to be matched to the correct request.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_REQUEST
message.description: Request list of ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_* items from the system/component.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies the unique number of the original request. This allows the response to be matched to the correct request.
Specifies the start index of the tag to be sent in the response.
Specifies the number of tag to be sent in the response after the skip index.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_RESPONSE
message.description: Response for ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_REQUEST. If success, device additional send ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_* items from start to stop index.[!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies the unique number of the original request. This allows the response to be matched to the correct request.
Record data type(it is also possible to know the type of data inside the record by cast enum to int).
Number of items ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_* for transmition after this request with success result code (depended from request).

message.name: ASV_SDR_SIGNAL_RAW
message.field: Signal name, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 8 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 8+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Timestamp (UNIX epoch time) for current set of measures.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_LLZ
message.field: Altitude (MSL). Positive for up. Note that virtually all GPS modules provide the MSL altitude in addition to the WGS84 altitude.
GPS HDOP horizontal dilution of position (unitless). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
GPS VDOP vertical dilution of position (unitless). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
GPS ground speed. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255
Altitude (above WGS84, EGM96 ellipsoid). Positive for up.
Vehicle heading (yaw angle), 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Frequency offset of signal 90 Hz of course.
Frequency offset of signal 150 Hz of course.
Frequency offset of signal 90 Hz of clearance.
Frequency offset of signal 150 Hz of clearance.
Total frequency offset of signal 90 Hz.
Total frequency offset of signal 150 Hz.
Phase difference 90 Hz clearance and cource
Phase difference 150 Hz clearance and cource.
Total frequency offset of signal 90 Hz.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_GP
message.field: Altitude (MSL). Positive for up. Note that virtually all GPS modules provide the MSL altitude in addition to the WGS84 altitude.
GPS HDOP horizontal dilution of position (unitless). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
GPS VDOP vertical dilution of position (unitless). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
GPS ground speed. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255
Altitude (above WGS84, EGM96 ellipsoid). Positive for up.
Vehicle heading (yaw angle), 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Frequency offset of signal 90 Hz of course.
Frequency offset of signal 150 Hz of course.
Frequency offset of signal 90 Hz of clearance.
Frequency offset of signal 150 Hz of clearance.
Total frequency offset of signal 90 Hz.
Total frequency offset of signal 150 Hz.
Phase difference 90 Hz clearance and cource
Phase difference 150 Hz clearance and cource.

message.name: ASV_SDR_RECORD_DATA_VOR
message.field: Altitude (MSL). Positive for up. Note that virtually all GPS modules provide the MSL altitude in addition to the WGS84 altitude.
GPS HDOP horizontal dilution of position (unitless). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
GPS VDOP vertical dilution of position (unitless). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
GPS ground speed. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255
Altitude (above WGS84, EGM96 ellipsoid). Positive for up.
Vehicle heading (yaw angle), 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Total frequency offset of signal 30 Hz.
Total frequency offset of signal 9960 Hz.
Total frequency offset of signal 90 Hz.
